reg_pit.title: Fort St. John Pilot Project Regulation

change.changenote: Section 1 (1) definition of "holder of a minor timber sale licence" was added by BC Reg 12/2010, effective January 15, 2010.
Section 1 (1) definition "minor timber sale licence" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 12/2010, effective January 15, 2010.

definition.def: means a timber sale licence described in section 3 (1) (d);

change.changenote: Section 3 (1) (h) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 12/2010, effective January 15, 2010.

paragraph.paragraphtext: a holder of a minor timber sale licence, as the holder of a road permit associated with the licence;

change.changenote: Section 3 (1) (i) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 12/2010, effective January 15, 2010.

paragraph.paragraphtext: a holder of a pulpwood agreement, referred to in paragraph (a), as the holder of a timber sale licence issued under section 23 (1) (a) of the Forest Act, to satisfy the obligations of the government under the pulpwood agreement.

change.changenote: Section 3 (5) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 12/2010, effective January 15, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of the pilot project, a provision of the Forest Act, the Forest Practices Code of British Columbia Act or the regulations under either of those Acts that requires the holder of an agreement, for a road or cutblock, to obtain a road permit, road use permit or cutting permit does not apply to a participant if the participant receives an authorization from the district manager under section 23 for that road or cutblock.

change.changenote: Section 13 (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The district manager may make his or her approval of a forest development plan or amendment subject to conditions.
